Sure he's a dictator but he abides by the laws and regulations of Outworld. Hell it even makes wonder if Mileena is the villain in the whole scenario.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554d45d363687236ef040200#post_554d45d363687236ef040200
It's even more fucked up if he's doing it to Cassie
topics.author: 4fe3df367f123b517900066a

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554d45d363687236ef040200#post_554d45d363687236ef040200
"HERE'S JOHNNY!"

"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554d45fa6368720351d40300#post_554d45fa6368720351d40300
And Sonya, too.
topics.author: 5446fcfc6368723ec21a0000

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554d45fa6368720351d40300#post_554d45fa6368720351d40300
He even follows the laws if it costs him his life. He knows that allying with Earthrealm would be much more beneficial than just conquering it. When he loses his duel to Kung Jin he gets on his knees and is willing to accept his potential death like a man. Shao Kahn would NEVER do that.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554d46666368725b2d7a0100#post_554d46666368725b2d7a0100
Well considering Johnny and Sonya's first interaction in MK 9 is Johnny hitting on her, and when she says no, you beat the shit out of her, it's not that surprising
topics.author: 4fe3df367f123b517900066a

topics.body: We all can agree, X-Ray kills tend to get better than Fatalities

topics.body: There aren't really very many members of the extended sonic cast that I actually hate.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body: And here's the weirdest part of MKX. Johnny Cage is more likable than Sonya Blade. Sonya just turned into a stone-faced biiiiiiiitch whereas Johnny lost some of his ego. JOHNNY WAS THE GOOD PARENT!
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
Can I just say something weird about Sonya?
When you use a fatality that cut your opponent in half vertically, her ponytail doesn't even move at all.
Is this something NetherRealm overlooked?
